name: European Automotive Research Partners Association
goal:
Founded in 2002, EARPA is the association of automotive R&D organisations. It brings together the most prominent independent R&D providers in the automotive sector throughout Europe. Its membership counts at present 51 members ranging from large and small commercial organisations to national institutes and universities.

EARPA, as the platform of automotive researchers, aims at actively contributing to the European Research Area and the future EU Framework Programmes.

In this task, EARPA seeks a close cooperation with the automotive industry, the automotive suppliers, the oil industry as well as the European Institutions and the EU Member States.
interests: Education, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: all on vehicle technology (including emissions, ITS technology, safety) as well as logistics and urban mobility
